c74object.name: binpan~
c74object.description: Takes an input signal and pans it binaurally to a spherical direction specified by azimuth and elevation. Performs convolution in the frequency domain based on HRTF inpulse responses from the CIPIC HRTF database. The database web page is no longer online but GitHub user amini-allight has uploaded the project resources to this repository: https://github.com/amini-allight/cipic-hrtf-database.

inlet.digest: Audio signal: signal to be panned.
inlet.description: Audio signal: signal to be panned.

inlet.digest: Azimuth (left to right on a semi-circle) panning position between 0.0 to 1.0.
inlet.description: 0 equals straight left and 1 equals straight right. Value will be folded internally to the 0-1 range.

inlet.digest: Elevation (down->front->up->back->down on a full circle) panning position between 0.0 to 2.0.
inlet.description: Determines the elevation angle of the "azimuth" semi-circle, where 0 (and 2) equals straight downward rotation, 0.5 equals straight forward, 1 equals straight upwards and 1.5 equals straight backwards. Note that with azimuth at the extremes (0 or 1), changes in elevation will have no effect due to the nature of this coordinate system. Also note that value goes to 2, since it goes full circle (2 Ï€ radians). Value will be wrapped internally around the 0-2 range.

inlet.digest: Message inlet for the 'read' message for reading HRTF matrix file and for changing the attributes by messages.
inlet.description: 'read' + [HRTF subject matrix file] reads the specified file into the internal jit.matrix to use for panning. For example: read subject_003.jit (.jit ending not strictly necessary). Attribute name followed by value sets attribute to that value.

objarg.name: FFT_window_overlap_factor
objarg.digest: Number of overlaps of FFT windows (required, 4 is recommended).
objarg.description: Number of overlaps of FFT windows. 4 is recommended for most applications. Must be a power of 2. A higher number generally means higher quality but also requires more processing power.

attribute.name: delay_smooth
attribute.digest: Smoothing of changes in the onset delays of HRTFs
attribute.description: Smoothing of changes in the onset delays. The amount of time (ms) it takes for the onset delays to reach new values. Default is 20.

attribute.name: matrix_name
attribute.digest: Set a different name for the internal jit.matrix
attribute.description: Sets a different name for internal jit.matrix allowing for different subject HRTF matrix files to be loaded into different panner instances. Defaults to the name 'subject_hrtf'.

method.name: read
method.digest: In right inlet: read a subject HRTF matrix file.
method.description: In right inlet: The word read followed by the name of one of the subject HRTF files reads the specified file into the internal jit.matrix to be used for the panning. If no argument is given (symbol, name of file) the open file dialog will show. The subject HRTF matrix files are located within the 'media' folder of this package.

method.name: float
method.digest: In 2nd and 3rd inlet, sets azimuth and elevation respectively for the panning direction.
method.description: A float (0. to 1.) in 2nd inlet will set the azimuth coordinate. A float (0. to 2.) in 3rd inlet will set the elevation coordinate.

method.name: signal
method.digest: In left inlet, signal to be panned.
method.description: In left inlet: signal to be panned binaurally.
